intro: Polypodium australe var. minutum, commonly known as the dwarf wall fern, is a small, evergreen fern native to Australia. It typically grows on rocky outcrops and in shaded, moist environments. The plant has lance-shaped, bright green fronds that are丛生 and often form dense mats. Its reproductive structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. This variety is characterized by its compact size and adaptability to harsh, rocky habitats.
